medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute episodes of parkinsonism and episodes of depression.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after birth with hyperphenylalaninemia discovered through neonatal screening. At 1 month, the patient was pale, somnolent, and exhibited few movements. Transient episodes of acute parkinsonism began at age 9, occurring twice a year, lasting from several minutes to several hours until treated with levodopa. Depression led to two suicide attempts at age 11. At age 29, an episode of severe akinesia and rest tremor occurred after 18 hours without treatment, resolving within 15 minutes post-administering levodopa.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hyperphenylalaninemia diagnosed after neonatal screening. Severe dihydropteridine reductase deficiency confirmed through undetectable DHPR activity.
medical_history.family_history: Parents are first cousins of Portuguese ancestry.
medical_history.social_history: Currently works as a town hall technician; no other relevant social history specified.
